intro: Galium serpenticum subsp. warnerense, commonly known as Warner's bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Galium genus with specific adaptations to its ecological niche.
